# Pushing a repo to a different folder in another repo (2025-11-07 08:13Z)

_**User (2025-11-07 08:14Z)**_

How can I push this repo to a different folder in another repo

---

_**Agent (model copilot/claude-sonnet-4.5)**_

To push this repo to a different folder in another repo, you have a few options:

## Option 1: Using Git Subtree (Recommended)

This allows you to push your current repo as a subdirectory in another repo:

```bash
# Navigate to the target repository
cd /path/to/target-repo

# Add your current repo as a subtree in a specific folder
git subtree add --prefix=path/to/folder /Users/shivpat/chamber-music main --squash

# Later, to update it:
git subtree pull --prefix=path/to/folder /Users/shivpat/chamber-music main --squash
```

## Option 2: Copy Files and Commit

Simple approach - just copy the files:

```bash
# In the target repository
cd /path/to/target-repo

# Copy the chamber-music folder
cp -r /Users/shivpat/chamber-music ./desired-folder-name

# Remove the .git directory to avoid nested repos
rm -rf ./desired-folder-name/.git

# Commit the changes
git add ./desired-folder-name
git commit -m "Add chamber-music project"
git push
```

## Option 3: Git Submodule

If you want to keep them as separate repos but linked:

```bash
# In the target repository
cd /path/to/target-repo

# Add as a submodule
git submodule add /Users/shivpat/chamber-music path/to/folder

git commit -m "Add chamber-music as submodule"
git push
```

**Which should you choose?**
- **Subtree**: Best if you want full integration and don't need to maintain separate history
- **Copy Files**: Simplest if it's a one-time move
- **Submodule**: Best if both repos need to be maintained separately
